examples: The flora has a harder time.
And as the world’s climate changed, so did its flora and fauna.
The frozen corpses of flora and fauna are buried beneath them.
While they might have had a hard time competing with the more complicated plants during the good times, the rest of the Paleozoic flora barely survived extinction.
Nerds across the pond were obsessed with American flora and fauna, and Franklin became the guy who could get you what you need.
words.defineEn: (botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
words.defineVi: (thực vật học) sinh vật sống không có khả năng vận động

examples: The floral arrangements adorned the altar, adding beauty to the church ceremony.
Unlike regular oranges, Temple oranges have a distinct floral note that enhances their sweet and tangy flavor.
He sprinkles dried chamomile petals on top of his favorite dessert for a touch of floral sweetness.
Still, floral waste makes up only about 16% of pollution that runs into the Ganges.
Avoid wearing bright colors or floral prints.
words.defineEn: resembling or suggesting the characteristics of flowers, such as delicacy or colorfulness
words.defineVi: giống hoặc gợi ý các đặc điểm của hoa, chẳng hạn như sự tinh tế hoặc màu sắc

words.defineEn: attack someone physically or emotionally
words.defineVi: tấn công ai đó về thể chất hoặc tình cảm

examples: The victim of the robbery stated that the assailant had slipped him a Mickey Finn at the bar.
The trainee must then confront an assailant.
Cadets attempt to subdue an aggressive assailant and apply handcuffs.
Then they have to run into this area where an assailant is waiting for them, and they have to take down this assailant and then make an arrest.
Narrator: Recruits learn control tactics used to detain and subdue an assailant.
words.defineEn: someone who attacks
words.defineVi: ai đó tấn công

examples: Because Medicaid covers people below or near the poverty line, the uninsured are usually not completely destitute.
Charitable organizations that housed the destitute.
Everyone is starved and destitute now and became even more so.
The migrant mother was not, as the photo's caption identified her, a "destitute pea-picker."
One sad example of how early environments affect children can be found in the work of American psychologist J. McVicker Hunt in a destitute Iranian orphanage in the 1970s.
words.defineEn: completely wanting or lacking
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn muốn hoặc thiếu

words.defineEn: a state without friends or money or prospects
words.defineVi: một trạng thái không có bạn bè, tiền bạc hay triển vọng

examples: Ancient Stoic philosopher Epicurus didn’t think so.
Eventually he got the offer of a lifetime: court physician to Emperor Marcus Aurelius, who was a battle-hardened general, Stoic philosopher, and all-around hardcore dude.
Open with each other, you guys are more stoic, tougher.
I think, because of various cultural reasons, there's reluctance to speak out and to be stoic, right, to not try to cause trouble.

Those who had held the hot cup of coffee perceived the person in the story as happier, more social, more generous and better-natured than those who had held the cup of iced coffee, who rated the person as cold, stoic, and unaffectionate.
words.defineEn: not displaying emotions and not complaining, especially in difficult and painful situations
words.defineVi: không thể hiện cảm xúc và không phàn nàn, đặc biệt là trong những tình huống khó khăn và đau đớn

words.defineEn: an indifference to pleasure or pain
words.defineVi: một sự thờ ơ với niềm vui hay nỗi đau

examples: First, there's the lingo.
There is a lot of insider lingo.
That's the lingo, come around.
So in this lingo, ultraviolet light is bluer than blue, and X-rays are bluer than ultraviolet.
Those spaces in the lingo of those people over the years were referred to islets, as ghettos.
words.defineEn: a characteristic language of a particular group (as among thieves)
words.defineVi: một ngôn ngữ đặc trưng của một nhóm cụ thể (như giữa những tên trộm)

words.defineEn: a mobile mass of muscular tissue covered with mucous membrane and located in the oral cavity
words.defineVi: một khối mô cơ di động được bao phủ bởi màng nhầy và nằm trong khoang miệng

words.defineEn: consisting of or related to language
words.defineVi: bao gồm hoặc liên quan đến ngôn ngữ

words.defineEn: of the same period
words.defineVi: cùng thời kỳ

examples: The situations were contemporary.
Again, contemporary science paints an interesting portrait here.
Austrian composer Johann Strauss also satirized contemporary composers in his "Perpetuum Mobile, Opus 257."
Upbeat contemporary music playing ♪
♪ contemporary music playing ♪
words.defineEn: having a modern or current style or design
words.defineVi: có phong cách hoặc thiết kế hiện đại hoặc hiện tại

examples: Groups tarred as the other or the enemy would face a level of vitriol not seen in decades.
I don’t think Barack Obama understood the degree of vitriol and anger and sense of betrayal that average working Americans felt, particularly after the financial crisis of 2008.
He had already been in the Republican Party, but he took over the Republican Party with his own brand of anger and vitriol and ugliness.
I think a lot of people agree with that, Senator Lott, but they're wondering how it can happen, because you have seen such vitriol since the election.

We have to give Clarence Thomas, Judge Thomas an opportunity to fight back and be fair and to prepare him for the hostility that he’s going to face in that Senate Hearing Room with the television cameras blazing, senators giving speeches filled with vitriol, many of them.
words.defineEn: criticism or comments that are severely cruel and hurtful
words.defineVi: những lời chỉ trích hoặc bình luận cực kỳ tàn nhẫn và gây tổn thương

examples: By the way, he still managed to die penniless, and only 8 people attended his funeral because of his vitriolic ridicule of Christianity.
The decision to move this monument was taken as an affront to that memory and set in motion a quite vitriolic and dramatic Russian response.
words.defineEn: of a substance, especially a strong acid; capable of destroying or eating away by chemical action
words.defineVi: của một chất, đặc biệt là axit mạnh; có khả năng phá hủy hoặc ăn mòn bằng tác động hóa học

words.defineEn: without prior preparation
words.defineVi: không chuẩn bị trước

examples: That was extemporaneous.
words.defineEn: with little or no preparation or forethought
words.defineVi: với ít hoặc không có sự chuẩn bị hoặc suy nghĩ trước

words.defineEn: cease an action temporarily
words.defineVi: tạm dừng một hành động

examples: Solar power is intermittent.
State-supplied power is intermittent across the country.
Intermittent fasting is probably a question I get all the time.
This is called intermittent reinforcement.
What is intermittent explosive disorder and what do we do about it?
words.defineEn: occurring irregularly over a period of time
words.defineVi: xảy ra bất thường trong một khoảng thời gian

examples: Lastly, there's the perpetual hurdle of intermittency.
And as usual, the intermittency of renewables poses a challenge, even as energy storage solutions get cheaper.
words.defineEn: the quality of being intermittent; subject to interruption or periodic stopping
words.defineVi: chất lượng không liên tục; bị gián đoạn hoặc dừng định kỳ
